1.text: You read Bane's manifesto and take {{dmg}} damage.

2.text: You read a treatise on metaepistemology and while satisfying you are exhausted.

3.text: You find a recipe for a cake and feel hungry.

5.text: You read a romantic passage, but can't put the book down. A complete waste of time.

table.7: You read many dusty pages until you have to sneeze. You close the book and hope the pages don't stick together.
table.11: You come across a new system of taxonomy and gain advantage on nature checks for the rest of the day.
table.13: You study the lineage of kings of the realms and have advantage on history checks for the rest of the day. You notice that for a family tree it certainly has a lot of loops
table.15: You read and understand a passage on metaphyiscs and gain +1 on all intelligence checks for the day.
table.18: You find a map containing the location of a hidden library.
table.23: You read a beautiful poem and become inspired. You may roll one check with advantage.

25.text: You find a scroll hidden between the pages of a book.

default.text: You just can't figure out which spell it is.

2.text: It's a scroll of cure wounds.

shop.text: You look around, but you can't find anything worthwhile.

fail.text: You are caught in the act.

default.text: You have to pay for bail.

table.10: You manage to talk your way out of it, but the guards are still suspicious.
table.15: You convince the guards it is all a prank.

crit.text: You maange to pin the blame on someone else and receive a reward for the tip

default.text: You don't find a suitable target and return empty handed.

6.text: You steal from a house, but the owner is even poorer than you.

12.text: You empty the till of a store, but the proprietor must have had a bad day.

18.text: You go through the sock drawer and find someone with a lack of trust in banks.

24.text: You find a jewelry store with bad security.

worship.text: You're not sure your prayers are answered or if anyone is even listening.

table.1: You lay around doing nothing and accomplish nothing.

hunt.text: You catch a coney. At least you have something to cook.

fail.text: Your hook gets stuck on a branch.

table.10: Luckily you manage to wriggle it free.

table.default: Nothing bites. You must be in the wrong place

10.text: You catch a Quipper. It bites you before you manage to subdue it.

20.text: You catch a barracuda. When you gut it, something shiny falls out

work.text: You do an adequate job and make {wage} silver pieces

perform.text: Your performance draws a small crowd and earn {3d4} silver pieces.
